title: As a user I want to create a new UEC for an Employee
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Contract+Header
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Info
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user navigates to any Employee Profile
OR Club user navigates the the Employee Profile of an Employee Belonging to their org
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
AND "Contracts" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND selecting "Contracts" should display a secondary dropdown
AND "Employee Contract" should be an option under the secondary dropdown
AND selecting "Employee Contract" from the Create New should load a new Preliminary Contract in edit mode for the relevant player/employee
AND the standard Employee header (or Player if they are not yet an Employee) should appear at the top of the Contract, as it does for Transactions/Profiles
AND the Info section should be expanded by default, and follow the wireframe and data discovery
AND the remainder of the sections should be visible in the contract, but all should be toggled to "No" and not expandable/removable with the delivery of this story
(NOTE: All action buttons and the status bar are handled in other test cases)

title: As a user I want to edit the Compensation section of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission for edit Employee Contract(UEC)
AND Employee has an existing Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC or Club clicks on Info tab on the Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Compensation" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will display one line per non-option year contained in the contract, beginning with the Contract Start Year. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The Service Start and End Dates should default to whatever values are entered in the Payment Start and End Date fields. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=compensation

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Compensation

title: As a user I want to add a Signing Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing the Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Signing Bonus" expandable section that appears below the "Options" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. By default, this is set to "No". 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, the format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=signing_bonus

title: As a user I want to add an Incentive Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Incentive Bonuses" expandable section that appears below the "Signing Bonus" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND By default, this section is toggled to No.  
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Incentive Bonus clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add incentive bonuses clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: IB1 would be the first clause, followed by IB2 and IB3. If IB2 is deleted, then IB3 would become IB2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=incentive_bonus

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Incentive+Bonuses

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*
  - *Duplicating clauses*
  - *Maximums Tables*

title: As a user I want to see the Create New icon on a professional player profile if I have employee create permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with employee create permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN If a user has any of the following permissions, then they should see a Create New icon on a Professional Player Profile: 
  - MJ Contract Admin
  - MN Contract Admin
  - MN Transactions Admin
  - MJ Transactions Admin
  - Employee Transactions Admin
  - Employee Contracts Admin
  - Investigations Admin
BUT If they do not have any of these permissions, then they do not see the create new icon on a professional player profile.
AND If the user has Employee Transactions Admin or Employee Contracts Admin, they should see these as options for a professional profile.

title: As a user I want to refresh the UEC to account for changes in the number of years included in a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Refresh" button available beneath the years fields. 
AND Clicking this button will update the contract to contain the entered number of years in the Compensation section, as well as in all of the dropdowns for Options, Salary Escalators and Incentive Bonuses. 
AND The screen can reload if necessary - but none of the information entered prior to hitting refresh should be lost UNLESS the user is removing years and information has been entered for one of the affected years. 
AND The screen should remain in edit mode.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

title: As a user I want to add an Options clause to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Options" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, if the "Option Years" value in the Info section is set to a number greater than 0 (and the contract has been appropriately refreshed), there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Options clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add options clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: OP1 would be the first clause, followed by OP2 and OP3. If OP2 is deleted, then OP3 would become OP2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=options

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Options

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the attachments of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to edit an Employee Contract
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to the Contract tab
AND click on the contract
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Executed Contract" expandable section that appears below the "Comments" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will allow the user to use the "drag and drop" area or the "Browse" button to add files to the contract. 
AND Once a file has been added, it appears in the table per the wireframe. 
AND Comments can be added to individual files. 
AND A label is required for each file attached, but the "Contract" label can only be used once. 
AND Only .pdf's should be accepted as valid files.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new UEC as Preliminary
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Save" button will save the contract as it is currently entered.
AND If the contract has not yet been saved, it is assigned a status of "Preliminary". 
AND The contract should reload in View mode whenever the contract is saved in any state.

title: As a user I want to be able to cancel changes to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Cancel" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Cancel" button will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.
AND If the user does not confirm, the blocking message is dismissed and the user is returned to the contract with their changes maintained. 
OR If the user does confirm, then, if the contract has never been saved, the user is returned to the point of entry, and the contract is completely discarded.
OR If the user does confirm, and the contract has been previously saved then the UEC reloads in View mode with no changes stored.

title: As a user I want to see what stored language I can choose for a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or LRD user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating a employee contract
AND the user has selected a clause or covenant 
AND the user has stored a language for the selected clause or covenant
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN Only stored languages that are on or after their effective dates, and have not been superseded by another effective date will display as an option. (Ex: a language with an effective date of 4/3/2012 will not display if there is a story with an effective date after 4/3/2012 but before today)
AND Only stored languages that are Approved will display as an option.
AND Only stored languages that belong to either LRD or the signing Org will be displayed in the dropdown.  
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a dropdown where the user can select which type of language they would like to use for that clause. 
AND The dropdown will contain a "Custom" option along with any stored language options that are able to be used for the specific contract.
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Upon selecting "Custom" as the language for the clause, a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form. 
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom language using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor. 
AND If the user changes the selection from "Custom" to a stored language, if they re-select "Custom" before navigating away from the page the WISYWIG should display any previously entered data. 
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a link that allows the user to navigate quickly to the stored language for that clause or covenant. 
AND When there is a stored language selected as the language for a clause, clicking the "View" link will open a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to view the text of my selected stored language

GIVEN a club and LRD is logged in with permission to create employee contract 
AND is creating an individual employee contract

AND a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to be able to re-add a removed Covenant

GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user editing the "Covenants" expandable section

AND Clicking this button will display a list of the Covenants available to add back into the UEC.
AND Each Covenant can only be added to a UEC once, so once it has been added back, it should be removed from the list. 
AND Once all covenants are present in the UEC, the "Add Covenant" button is no longer available.

title: As a user I want to be able to duplicate an Incentive Bonus clause on a UEC

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club or BOC user with Edit permissions for a UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a UEC in Edit or View Mode in Preliminary
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an Update Status button
AND clicking the "Update Status" button should display the option to move the contract to "Submit Signed"
AND selecting "Submit Signed" should perform a required field and formatting check, and if that passes then save the contract as it is currently entered
AND the contract should be assigned a status of "Submit Signed"
AND the contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green
AND the contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode
AND a blue notification should display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Submit Signed
AND any "Rejection Reason" comments that were previously visible on the UEC should be removed
AND an Approvals item should be generated for the BOC
AND the Action Item for the UEC should be removed.
AND if the employee's current position does not match that contained in the UEC, then an Assign/Reassign Transaction should be auto-created and submitted by the system for the position contained on the UEC

title: As a user I want to see an Employee Contract reflected in the employee's History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club or BOC user logs in with UEC permission
AND An employee has an approved UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Employee's History
custom_expected:
THEN system should display the following information about the UEC: 
  * Date on the History corresponds with the Signing Date.
  * Code is "EE Cont"
  * Org/Club From is the Signing Org. 
  * Org/Club To is blank.
  * Description reads: "Signed Negotiated Employee Contract - Position: <Position> Years: X Option Years: Z 1st Year: YYYY" where <Position> is replaced with the Position from the contract (ex: Coach), X is the guaranteed years and Z is option years. YYYY is replaced with the first year of the contract.
AND Clicking on the description opens the contract.

title: As a user I want any attachment with a label of Contract to be stamped on approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user created a Employee contract 
And Attached valid contract PDF
custom_steps: WHEN the Contract is moved from Update Status - > Approved
custom_expected:
THEN system will prompt the user to pick where to place the signature stamp. 
AND "Default" will be the default selection on the pop up. 
AND "Custom" will be the other option. Selecting "Custom" will display fields for the user to specify the page (counted back from the last page) and the x/y coordinates for the signature stamp. The fields will default to the default location as calculated by the system based on the current version of the saved contract. 
AND "None" will be another option. Selecting "None" will not stamp the contract at all when "Approve" is clicked. 
AND The buttons on the pop up will be "Approve" and "Cancel". 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will close the popup and cancel the state change. 
AND If "Custom" is selected, the "Approve" button will be disabled if any of the fields are left blank. Otherwise, clicking Approve will stamp the attached pdf with the signature stamp in the indicated location. 
AND If "Default" is selected, the "Approve" button is always enabled and the system will stamp the attached pdf on Approve in the default location. 
AND The date used is the date the UEC was Approved.

*Note that this matches the process used for MJ Contracts*

custom_expected:
THEN Superceded contract to be moved back to re-enacted as the 'active'

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing UEC
custom_preconds:
View-Edit-State Change Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules
On Save Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.++On+Save
**All of these steps assume proper edit permissions and that Club users belong to the Signing Org**
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit an existing UEC
custom_expected:
THEN Club users should be able to edit any portion of the UEC in Preliminary and Reject Signed states
AND Club users should only be able to edit the Authorized Signatory, Signing Date, and Attached Files in a Completed State
AND Club users should not see an edit button in the Submit Signed or Approved or higher states
AND BOC users should be able to edit any fields in all of the states
AND saving in any state other than Preliminary and Reject Signed should run all required field and formatting checks
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should run all required field and formatting checks, as well as all On Submit and On Approve rules
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should check that there is not a new "Contract" attachment
AND if there is a new "Contract" attachmen, the user should be given the option to stamp the attached contract
AND the stamp should have the date of the Approval - not the current date

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Expire UEC batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN CLUB and BOC user  has employee permission
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Major Contracts" section on the batch screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should see "UEC Expiration Batch" option 
AND Clicking "UEC Expiration Batch" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
AND The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
AND A "Run" button is available. 
AND Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
AND When the batch is run: 
    - Get all approved contracts to be expired (contracts whose latest service end date is in the past.)
    - Iterate over contracts
    - If there are no options - expire the contract
    - If the last year is an option year - expire the contract only if none of the options are exercised.
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired and have contracts that were in "Approved for Next Season" state are updated to "Approved" state
    - If the employee has an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for and it is for the same organization as the contract being expired, then if the employee‰Ûªs current position is different than the position in the contract not being expired, a reassign to org transaction is generated for the employee and Submitted to BOC.
    - If any of the contracts being moved to an "Approved" state overlap with a current Approved contract, then update the status of the existing Approved contract to "Superseded" 
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired who do NOT have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired should have a Remove Employee from Org transaction generated for them and Submitted to BOC.      
AND Results will only include employees who had a contract updated by the batch and should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Errors, Player ID, Name (Last, Roster), Org (current Org), Contract ID, Signing Org (Org contract is with), 
Start Year, Non Option Yrs, Option Yrs, Status (Contract Status)
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/11.+UEC+Expiration+Batch

title: As a Club user I want to see the Employee Contract widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Contracts+Widget+-+Data+Discovery
Wireframe: 
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_contracts
GIVEN the Employee Contracts widget is located beneath the Employee Rosters widget on the Employees tab
AND a club user is logged in with permission to view the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user loads the Employee Contracts widget as a Club user
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the widget per the data discovery and the provided wireframe
AND the "Org" filter and column should not be present for Club users
AND the widget should be populated with all of the employees that the Org has
AND the "Current Contract" columns should be populated using the employees currently "active" UEC (their Completed, Submit Signed, Approved or Approved for Next Season UEC with the earliest Service Start Date)
AND the "Next Contract" columns should be populated using the employees next UEC, based on whichever UEC has a Service Start date next after the Current's Service Start Date. (Example: if the Employee's current UEC's start date is 1/1/17 and they have subsequent UECs with a start date of 1/18/18 and one with a start date of 1/20/18, display the one with the 1/18/18 date as the "Next").
AND UECs with start dates before the start date of the employee's Current UEC should not be displayed. (Example: if the employee's current UEC's start date is 1/1/17 and they only have a Preliminary UEC with a start date of 1/1/16, no UEC would be displayed in the "Next" columns until a UEC is entered for that employee with a service date equal to or later than the current service start date)
AND if no Service Start date has been entered for a UEC, use the "Starting in Year" field to determine if the UEC is for a Year that falls after the employee's current UEC. If this field is somehow not populated, or is before the current UEC's Service Start Date, system should not display the information for this UEC. If the Starting Year is equal to that of the Service Start Date of the Current UEC, system should display it
AND the Header "Level" filter should work appropriately
AND widget exports and other default widget behavior should work (export to excel, export to PDF)

title: Employee Contracts - Viewer Permissions- BOC
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Contracts Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN BOC user should be able to view and Print all employee contracts in all states 
AND user should be able to view all flags for employee contracts and their attachments in all states
BUT user should not be able to make any changes or e-sign

title: Employee Contracts - Editor permissions - BOC
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Contracts Editor Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user attempts to do anything with Employee Contracts
custom_expected:
THEN BOC user should be able to view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees
AND user should be able to create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees.
AND BOC user should be able to Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions

title: Employee Contracts - Field Personnel Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Field Personnel Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN Club users with a Field Personnel Viewer permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Field Personnel".
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Field Personnel Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Field Personnel contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.

title: Employee Contracts - Field Personnel Creator Permissions
custom_preconds:
Permission and Position types wiki:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Permissions

GIVEN a user is logged in with UEC - Field Personnel Creator Permission
AND user does NOT have any other UEC related permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a UEC
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to create, edit, and submit UECs for Field Personnel type emps from their own org(can create new for any emp in their org but only Field Personnel positions will be available to choose)
AND user should be able to view UECs in any state that they themselves created
BUT user should NOT be able to create or view UECs for any emps in their org that are NOT Field Personnel Type emps
AND user should not be able to view ANY UEC that they did not create
AND user should NOT be able to create or view UECs for emps from other orgs
